tables.name: Table_Sales
tables.purpose: Records all sales transactions including product details, customer information, and financial amounts.

columns.name: Shop_Name
columns.description: Name of the shop where sale occurred.

columns.name: Order_No
columns.description: Unique order number for each transaction.

columns.name: Order_Date
columns.description: Date on which the order was placed.

columns.name: Invoice_No
columns.description: Invoice or challan number linked to the order.

columns.name: Invoice_Date
columns.description: Date when the invoice was issued.

columns.name: Item_Name
columns.description: Name of the sold product item.

columns.name: Item_Category_Name
columns.description: Category name of the sold item (e.g., Beverage, Grocery).

columns.name: Item_Qty
columns.description: Quantity of the item sold in the transaction.

columns.name: Item_Rate
columns.description: Unit price or rate of the sold item.

columns.name: Customer_Name
columns.description: Name of the customer who made the purchase.

columns.name: Customer_Address
columns.description: Address of the customer for delivery or billing.

columns.name: Delivery_Date
columns.description: Scheduled or actual delivery date of the order.

columns.name: Delivery_Charge
columns.description: Additional delivery charge applied to the order.

examples.query: Show total sales amount by category for this month
examples.sql: SELECT Item_Category_Name, SUM(Item_Qty * Item_Rate) AS Total_Sales FROM Table_Sales WHERE strftime('%Y-%m', Order_Date) = strftime('%Y-%m', 'now') GROUP BY Item_Category_Name;

examples.query: How many orders were placed today?
examples.sql: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT Order_No) AS Total_Orders FROM Table_Sales WHERE date(Order_Date) = date('now');
SELECT strftime('%Y-%m', Order_Date) AS Month, SUM(Item_Qty * Item_Rate) AS Total_Sales FROM Table_Sales WHERE Order_Date >= date('now', '-4 months') GROUP BY strftime('%Y-%m', Order_Date);
